Shinsei,
  I have been calling you sensei out of respect. Since I am the one 
asking the questions and you are the one answering, you are my sensei.
 I appreciate your help in everything. Have a great year and I hope to 
talk with you some more sometime.
   L.G.B.


--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "Shinsei <sinseism@y...>" 
<sinseism@y...> wrote:
> Hi, LB
> 
> the Kanji in the link means "Kiyomitsu",not Koumitsushi.If you want 
> the Kanji for Koumitsushi,I will show you later somehow.
> 
> By the way,Thank you for seeing my profile.
> My name is Shinsei ,not Sensei.But the word "sensei" means master or 
> teacher,which makes me feel great.It's all right to call me sensei 
if 
> you wantto.lol!Actually I have a tutoring work,and am sometimes 
> called sensei...
> 
> Shinsei
